subject: Re: Test Dependencies
msgSnippet: ... No argument there. ... Hmm.. interesting, I would tend to think of save & load as two separate, but complimentary, behaviours. ... So then, where does that
messageBody:
--- In junit@yahoogroups.com, Kevin Klinemeier <zipwow@y...> wrote:
> I think one answer (out of many) is that you want to test one
> *behavior* at a time.

No argument there.

> With this class, that behavior is that anything saved with
> saveLicense() can be loaded with loadLicense(...). So that
> makes good sense (to me) as a single test.

Hmm.. interesting, I would tend to think of save & load as two
separate, but complimentary, behaviours.

> If you had some kind of requirement that things written with
> saveLicense have a particular format, or that loadLicense expects a
> particular format (for 3rd party integration or something), then
> you'd have more behaviors and probably want to make separate tests.

So then, where does that format come from in the problem in hand? You
must certainly have a format defined.. or how could you write either
save or load?

> Even in
> that case, though, testing that stuff saved with saveLicense can be
> loaded with loadLicense isn't a bad thing to do.

Yes. Agreed. But try to avoid using a file to do it.

Dave
